node.title: Demaryius Thomas, Ex-Denver Bronco, Is Found Dead
node.alt: Demaryius Thomas playing for the Houston Texans against the Indianapolis Colts 2018 in Texas.
node.description: The 33-year-old had played for the National Football League for 10 seasons and helped lead the Broncos to victory in the Super Bowl in 2016. He retired in June.
node.content: ["Demaryius Thomas, a former star wide receiver for the Denver Broncos who played for the National Football League for 10 seasons before retiring in June, died at his home in Roswell, Ga., on Thursday. He was 33. ", "His death was confirmed by a spokesman for the Roswell Police Department, who said in an email, \u201cPreliminary information is that his death stems from a medical issue.\u201d", "The N.F.L. described Mr. Thomas as a \u201cstandout\u201d player. He played with the league for a decade, primarily with the Broncos, where he was a five-time Pro Bowler. In 2016, Mr. Thomas helped lead the Broncos to an unexpected victory against the Carolina Panthers in Super Bowl 50. In a statement, the Broncos said he \u201cestablished himself as a dominant record-setting wide receiver who was an instrumental part of two championship runs and our victory in Super Bowl 50.\u201d", "Mr. Thomas was selected among the Top 100 N.F.L. players four times and was the Broncos\u2019 second-leading receiver. He was traded to the Houston Texans during the 2018 season and later moved to the New York Jets before ending his career. By then, he had 724 passes for 9,763 yards and 63 touchdowns.", "Mr. Thomas was born on Dec. 25, 1987, in Montrose, Ga. He had two younger sisters. ", "According to a biography of Mr. Thomas on the Denver Broncos website, his mother, Katina Smith, and his grandmother Minnie Pearl Thomas were arrested on drug-distribution charges when he was 11. His father was serving in the Army was in Kuwait at the time, according to local news reports. His mother was sentenced to 20 years in prison and his grandmother to life without parole.", "In 2015, President Barack Obama commuted his mother\u2019s sentence. She later wrote about expressing regret for the crime and seeking freedom for her mother, who was still in prison. \u201cBecause I refused to testify against my mother,\u201d she wrote, \u201cI received a 20-year mandatory sentence because I did not give \u2018substantial assistance\u2019 to the prosecution.\u201d", "The following year, Mr. Thomas met the president at the White House, according to the Broncos\u2019 website. \u201cWe talked for a quick second,\u201d he said. \u201cI told him \u2018Thank you for what you\u2019ve done for my family,\u2019 for giving my mother clemency.\u201d", "That same year, Mr. Obama commuted the sentence for Mr. Thomas\u2019s grandmother, after she had spent 16 years in federal prison. Mr. Thomas said at the time: \u201cThis was a blindside shot, but I\u2019m happy. I\u2019m excited. The past two years, I got my grandmother and my mother out. And a lot of other people got their family members out that didn\u2019t do crazy crimes, so it\u2019s a blessing.\u201d", "Information on his survivors was not immediately available.", "Jeff Clayton, who coached Mr. Thomas when he was a student at West Laurens High School in Dexter, Ga., said in an interview that as a teenager, Mr. Thomas had showed talent both as a football and a basketball player, but that he \u201cdidn\u2019t want to be in the spotlight.\u201d", "Later in his career, Mr. Thomas would return to the high school to visit students, Mr. Clayton said. \u201cEverybody would gravitate towards him,\u201d he recalled. But \u201che never really changed from that humble little kid,\u201d he added.", "Mr. Thomas attended Georgia Tech, where he was drafted by the Broncos as the 22nd pick. ", "In June, when he announced his retirement in a video posted on the Broncos\u2019 Twitter feed, he said: \u201cI\u2019m going to retire a Denver Bronco. I\u2019m honored; I\u2019m grateful; I\u2019m appreciative.\u201d", "In the video, Mr. Thomas recalled his first touchdown with the N.F.L.", "\u201cEvery time I see it, every time I watch it, I still get the chills,\u201d he said, adding, \u201cI\u2019m just happy to say I\u2019m done and it did me well.\u201d"]
